msDesc.head: Collection of works by Nikephoros of Constantinople

msItem.note: Table of contents in form of summary of each chapter. (The titles given here do not correspond to the titles preceding the relevant texts in the text body) tit. Τάδε ἔνεστιν ἐν τῇδε τῆ βίβλῳ. Cf. PG 100, 832–833.

msItem.author: Nikephoros of Constantinople
msItem.title: Apologeticus pro incunabili, pura et immaculata nostra christianorum fide et contra eos qui putant nos idolis cultum exhibere

msItem.author: Nikephoros of Constantinople
msItem.title: Refutatio et eversio deliramentorum inscite et impie ab irreligiosi Mamonae vaniloquentia dictorum adversus salutarem dei verbi incarnationem
msItem.note: i) fols 220r-307r: Antirrheticus primus, PG 100, 205–328, ii) fols 307r-340r: Antirrheticus secundus, PG 100, 329–373, iii) fols 340r-454r: Antirrheticus tertius, PG 100, 375–533.

msItem.author: Nikephoros of Constantinople
msItem.title: Proemium quinque et septuaginta testimoniorum subsequentium, Testimonia patrum
msItem.note: Ed. J. B. Pitra, Spicilegium solesmense: complectens Sanctorum Patrum scriptorumque ecclesiasticorum anecdota hactenus opera, selecta e Graecis Orientalibusque et Latinis codicibus, 4 vols, Paris, 1852–1858, vol. 1, 337–370.
Refutatio ac eversio Eusebii simul et Epiphanidis sermonum, adversus Salvatoris nostri Jesu Christi incarnationem nugatorie jactatorum

msItem.author: Nikephoros of Constantinople
msItem.title: Contra Eusebium
msItem.note: Ed. J. B. Pitra, Spicilegium solesmense: complectens Sanctorum Patrum scriptorumque ecclesiasticorum anecdota hactenus opera, selecta e Graecis Orientalibusque et Latinis codicibus, 4 vols, Paris, 1852–1858, vol. 1, 373–503.

msItem.author: Nikephoros of Constantinople
msItem.title: Adversus Epiphanidem
msItem.note: Ed. J. B. Pitra, Spicilegium solesmense: complectens Sanctorum Patrum scriptorumque ecclesiasticorum anecdota hactenus opera, selecta e Graecis Orientalibusque et Latinis codicibus, 4 vols, Paris, 1852–1858, vol. 4, 294–380.

msItem.author: Nikephoros of Constantinople
msItem.title: Censura sive explicatio Quorumdam secus allatorum adversus sacras imagines testimoniorum, ex his accepta qui rectum Ecclesiae dogma defenderunt. de Magnete
msItem.note: Ed. J. B. Pitra, Spicilegium solesmense: complectens Sanctorum Patrum scriptorumque ecclesiasticorum anecdota hactenus opera, selecta e Graecis Orientalibusque et Latinis codicibus, 4 vols, Paris, 1852–1858, vol. 1, 302–335.

msItem.author: Nikephoros of Constantinople
msItem.title: Antirrheticus, Adversus Iconomachos
msItem.note: Ed. J. B. Pitra, Spicilegium solesmense: complectens Sanctorum Patrum scriptorumque ecclesiasticorum anecdota hactenus opera, selecta e Graecis Orientalibusque et Latinis codicibus, 4 vols, Paris, 1852–1858, vol. 4, 233–291. 1585

handDesc.handNote: Two scribes: i) fols 1–549r and ii) fols 549v-726 (Λεόντιος Εὐστράτιος of Cyprus, 1584–1585, see marginalia below for his scribal note on fol. 726r, RGK II, 325).

decoDesc.decoNote: Several headpieces in red ink before certain sections, fols 489v; large initial uncial letters in the beginning of chapters, fols 16v, 220r, 227v, 307r, 340r, 489v. After Λεόντιος Εὐστράτιος takes over the initials are significantly smaller in size (fols 550r, 588v, 658r, 679r).

physDesc.additions: Fol. iii(r): Νικηφόρου κωνσταντινουπόλεως; fol. 32r: ἄφισε τοῦ καὶ ἄγωμεν ὀμπρὸς εἰς τὸ ε´ τετράδιον διὰ τὸ σφάλμα τοῦ σταχωτῆ.; fol. 40r: ἄγωμεν ὀμπρὸς ἕναν τετράδιον, εἰς τὸ ζ δ; τὸ σφάλμα τοῦ σταχωτῆ. ; fol. 726r: τέλος καὶ τῷ θεῷ δόξα ἐν ἔτη ιζςγω ὑπῆρχε δὲ τὸ ἀντίγραφον ιςτλθ´ ἐτῶν.

binding.p: Typical Holkham binding of brown leather, with Coke family ostrich crest in gilt in the centre of the upper cover; Date: early nineteenth century. Rebound by John Jones of Liverpool (worked for Holkham 1816–1823). The spine lettered in gilt, in pasted black leather: / S. NICEPHORI/ VARIA/ ET/ ALIORUM/ PATRUM/ COLLECTANEA/ GR.–//M.S./ SÆC. /; also in pasted black leather: MS. /HOLKHAM/ Gr. 59

origin.origDate: 1585 (the text is said to be copied from an exemplar of the year 831)

history.provenance:
Ownership Notes: fol. iii(v): (in red ink) + ὀνησάμην τήνδε τὴν βίβλον
παρὰ τοῦ μιχαὴλου μορεζήνου ἀ
δελφοῦ ἡμετέρου, ὃς ἔσχεν
αὐτὴν ἐκ τοῦ νικολάου μα
ζαράκη, ὡς ἔφη αὐτὸς δωρον
αχς. δεκεμβρίω αη; Obtained from Nikolaos Mazarakis by Michael Morezenos, who sold the MS to his brother in 1606, 1st of December.

Old Catalogue Nrs: 1st paste down (in the centre, in pencil): MS. Holkham Gr. 59; fol. i(r) (in pencil); Holk Cat. No 89 4 CI B.8.; fol. iii(v) (on the top in black ink) ΙΒον= Morezenos 12; handwritten note in black ink by B. de Montfaucon: 1698· Codex 33. Nicephori varia et patrum colleactanea ex scri
pta anno 1546. ex codice exarato anno 831·
a Christo ut in fine libri legimus. Giustiniani 33; Olim Holkham Hall, Libr. of the Earl of Leicester, 84.

recordHist.source: Description by Dimitrios Skrekas (2019), with the support of the Leventis Foundation, the Oxford Centre for Byzantine Research, the Yerolemou Trust and the Michael Marks Charitable Trust.

ref.title: Pinakes | Πίνακες: Textes et manuscrits grecs
